title: An Unusual $1.6 Billion Donation Bolsters Conservatives
abstract: A low-profile Republican financier donated his company to a new group run by the influential operative Leonard A. Leo.
byline: By Kenneth P. Vogel and Shane Goldmacher

multimedia.caption: Leonard A. Leo has used his connections to Republican donors and politicians to help finance battles over judicial appointments, abortion rights, voting rules and climate change policy.
multimedia.copyright: T.J. Kirkpatrick for The New York Times

title: How Trump’s Endorsements Elevate Election Lies and Inflate His Political Power
abstract: The former president’s endorsements have been focused more on personal politics than on unseating Democrats.
byline: By Michael C. Bender, Rebecca Lieberman and Eden Weingart

multimedia.caption: Candidates endorsed by former President Donald J. Trump appear at rallies he has hosted. Clockwise from top left: J.D. Vance, Kari Lake, John Gibbs and Kelly Tshibaka.
multimedia.copyright: Clockwise from top left: Maddie McGarvey; Ash Ponders; Brittany Greeson; Ash Adams. All photos for The New York Times

title: Flash Floods at National Parks Strand 200 and Leave a Hiker Missing
abstract: A hiker at Zion National Park in Utah remained missing and visitors and staff members were stranded for more than nine hours at Carlsbad Caverns National Park in New Mexico on Saturday.

multimedia.caption: At Carlsbad Caverns National Park, visitors were forced to shelter in place when flooded roads became impassable on Saturday.
multimedia.copyright: Laura Steele, via National Park Service

title: Is a Fetus a Person? An Anti-Abortion Strategy Says Yes.
abstract: Fetal personhood, which confers legal rights from conception, is an effort to push beyond abortion bans and classify the procedure as murder. In Georgia, it also means a $3,000 tax credit.
des_facet: Dobbs v Jackson Women's Health Organization (Supreme Court Decision)

title: Student Fatally Shot by Woman He Stopped to Help
abstract: Adam Simjee was with his girlfriend in a national forest in Alabama when a woman flagged them down, claiming she had car trouble.

multimedia.caption: Adam Simjee and his girlfriend Mikayla Paulus. Mr. Simjee died in an exchange of gunfire last week after a woman pretending to be a stranded driver forced them into the woods.
multimedia.copyright: GoFundMe

title: Federal Appeals Court Halts Graham Testimony Before Atlanta Grand Jury
abstract: The U.S. Court of Appeals for the 11th Circuit temporarily blocked Senator Lindsey Graham from testifying before a special grand jury investigating Donald Trump’s efforts to overturn the 2020 election results in Georgia.

multimedia.caption: A federal appeals court temporarily blocked Senator Lindsey Graham, Republican of South Carolina, on Sunday from having to testify before a special grand jury in Atlanta.
multimedia.copyright: Pete Marovich for The New York Times

title: ‘We Don’t Want DeSantis to Just Walk Into the White House’
abstract: Democrats would love to defeat Gov. Ron DeSantis of Florida in November. But first they must nominate a challenger who can win in a state where they seem to perpetually fall short.

title: How a Storied Phrase Became a Partisan Battleground
abstract: A touchstone of political and social discourse, the nearly 100-year-old phrase “the American dream,” is being repurposed — critics say distorted — particularly by Republicans of color.

multimedia.copyright: Elias Nesser/Getty Images
Elias Nesser/Getty Images
Elias Nesser/Getty Images

title: San Antonio Man Threatened Conservative Student Conference, Authorities Say
abstract: The man, Alejandro Richard Velasquez Gomez, 19, said in a social media post that July 22 — the beginning of a three-day Turning Point USA conference in Tampa, Fla. — would be “the day of retribution,” investigators said.

multimedia.caption: Donald Trump at the Turning Point USA Student Action Summit in Tampa, Fla., last month. Investigators said Alejandro Richard Velasquez Gomez was planning to target the conference.

title: Parts of Mexico and Texas Are Under a Tropical Storm Warning
abstract: Forecasters said a short-lived tropical storm could form and bring rain and storm surges.

title: The Final Days of the Trump White House: Chaos and Scattered Papers
abstract: Government documents that President Donald J. Trump had accumulated were with him in roughly two dozen boxes in the White House residence. They were to go to the National Archives, but at least some ended up in Florida.
byline: By Maggie Haberman, Katie Benner and Glenn Thrush

multimedia.caption: President Donald J. Trump and his wife, Melania, leaving the White House for the last time on Jan. 20, 2021.

title: Giuliani Associate Sought Pardon for Him After Jan. 6, Book Says
abstract: The letter, which also requested that Rudolph W. Giuliani be awarded the Presidential Medal of Freedom, was intercepted before reaching President Donald J. Trump.

title: Stacey Abrams’s Personal Evolution on Abortion Rights
abstract: The Georgia Democrat, a child of Methodist preachers, once identified as an abortion foe. Now, she is putting her defense of abortion rights — and the story of her conversion — at the center of her campaign for governor.

multimedia.caption: Stacey Abrams uses her story to connect with voters who personally oppose abortion. “I want people to understand that I know where they’re coming from,” she said.
multimedia.copyright: Diwang Valdez for The New York Times

title: As Alaska Warms, Fires Burn Over (and Under) More Wild Land
abstract: Lightning storms, drought and thawing tundra are making fires more destructive. In the vast wilderness, firefighting is a major challenge.

title: Florida Utility Is Fined $500,000 for 2017 Explosion That Killed 5
abstract: Tampa Electric Company pleaded guilty in May to “willfully” violating an OSHA rule that required workers to receive a pre-job briefing about the work they were to perform.

title: After Signing Climate Bill, Biden Prepares More Actions to Cut Emissions
abstract: Regulations from the E.P.A. and elsewhere will help the president meet his aggressive climate goals, administration officials say.

title: Group Seeks to Block Abortion Vote in Michigan, Citing Typography
abstract: The effort is aimed at keeping a constitutional amendment to guarantee abortion rights off the ballot. A voting access measure is also being challenged.

title: A Former Fox News Insider Spills the Beans
abstract: Chris Stirewalt was part of a pivotal decision to declare Joe Biden the winner of Arizona in 2020. Now he’s speaking out about a network he says incites “black-helicopter-level paranoia and hatred.”
byline: By Blake Hounshell and Jeremy W. Peters
des_facet: Broken News: Why the Media Rage Machine Divides America and How to Fight Back (Book)

multimedia.caption: Chris Stirewalt, a former Fox News journalist, appeared in June before the House committee investigating the Capitol riot.

title: Lawmakers Demand Social Media Firms Address Threats to Law Enforcement
abstract: The Democrats who lead two House panels also expressed concern about “reckless statements” from Republicans after a surge in online threats following the F.B.I. search of Mar-a-Lago.

title: Graham Ordered to Appear Before Atlanta Grand Jury Investigating Trump
abstract: A federal judge declined to stay her order that Senator Lindsey Graham of South Carolina appear on Tuesday before a special grand jury in Atlanta.

multimedia.caption: Senator Lindsey Graham of South Carolina has fought a subpoena to appear in person before a special grand jury in Atlanta that is investigating efforts by Donald J. Trump and his allies to overturn the results of the 2020 election in Georgia.

title: DeSantis, Eyeing 2024, Rallies With the Trump-Backed Far Right
abstract: Appearing with right-wing candidates in Pennsylvania and Ohio, the Florida governor signaled his desire to take over Donald Trump’s political movement. Whether Republican voters want that to happen remains to be seen.
byline: By Trip Gabriel and Patricia Mazzei

multimedia.caption: Doug Mastriano, left, and Gov. Ron DeSantis of Florida appeared together in Pittsburgh on Friday. Mr. DeSantis has rallied with Republican candidates in several battleground states recently, including Arizona.
multimedia.copyright: Maddie McGarvey for The New York Times
